Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery krater; outside, legs of youth holding a lowered torch, flames in added white and a sash, also in white; to right, legs of a draped figure, seemingly cut off below; inside, black glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked N inside. Probably a lampadodromia (torch race) scene. Close to Fitzwilliam Museum GR.157.1899 in style and subject matter.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 12, N 39)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 64, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1145)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2962 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
